At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

RA-5.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency and/or randomly in accordance with organization-defined process] d. [Assignment: organization-defined response times] e. [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]
RA-5.defined_value: a. At least every 120 days. d. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. e. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

RA-5(2).control_text: [Selection (one or more): [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; prior to a new scan; when new vulnerabilities are identified and reported].
RA-5(2).defined_value: Within 24 hours prior to running scans.

RA-5(5).control_text: [Assignment: organization-identified information system components] [Assignment: organization-defined vulnerability scanning activities]
RA-5(5).defined_value: Authorized vulnerability scanning components. Authorization by the CISO/SISO or designate.

SA-1.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] b. 1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] b.2. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
SA-1.defined_value: a. All personnel. b.1. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. b.2. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

SA-9(2).defined_value: All external information systems and services.

SA-12.defined_value: Security safeguards in accordance with CNSSD No. 505, Supply Chain Risk Management.

SC-1.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] b.1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] b.2. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
SC-1.defined_value: a. All personnel. b.1. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. b.2. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

SC-7(8).control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined internal communications traffic] [Assignment: organization-defined external networks]
SC-7(8).defined_value: All internal communications traffic that may be proxied, except traffic specifically exempted by the Authorizing Official or organizational policy. All untrusted networks outside the control of the organization.

SC-7(12).control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined host-based boundary protection mechanisms] [Assignment: organization-defined information system components]
SC-7(12).defined_value: Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. All system components capable of supporting host-based boundary protection mechanisms such as but not limited to servers, workstations, and those subject to operation outside of the organizational boundary( i.e., laptops and other mobile devices).

SC-7(14).defined_value: Any managed interface that crosses security domains or connects to an external network; such as but not limited to: cross domain solutions (SABI, TSABI), a network boundary with a WAN, a partner network, or the Internet.

SC-8(1).control_text: [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical safeguards].
SC-8(1).defined_value: Prevent unauthorized disclosure of, and detect changes to, information. Alternative physical safeguards such as keeping transmission within physical areas rated IAW the sensitivity of the information or within a Protected Distribution System (PDS) when traversing areas not approved for the sensitivity of the information.

SC-11.control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined security functions to include at a minimum, information system authentication and re-authentication]
SC-11.defined_value: Information system authentication and re- authentication; functions other than the minimum required are not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

SC-12.control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction]
SC-12.defined_value: For unclassified NSS, NIST FIPS-compliant; and/or for classified NSS, see the Classified Information Overlay; processes/requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction.

SC-12(2).defined_value: NIST FIPS-compliant for unclassified data, and/or See Classified Information Overlay for classified data.

SC-15.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed]
SC-15.defined_value: Dedicated VTC suites located in approved VTC locations that are centrally managed.

SC-15(4).defined_value: All VTC and all IP based online meetings and conferences (excludes audio only teleconferences using traditional telephony).

SC-17.defined_value: The certificate policy defined in CNSSP No. 25.

SC-18(2).defined_value: The following requirements: (a) Emerging mobile code technologies that have not undergone a risk assessment and been assigned to a Risk Category by the CIO are not used. (b) Category 1 mobile code is signed with a code signing certificate; use of unsigned Category 1 mobile code is prohibited; use of Category 1 mobile code technologies that cannot block or disable unsigned mobile code (e.g., Windows Scripting Host) is prohibited. (c) Category 2 mobile code which executes in a constrained environment without access to system resources (e.g., Windows registry, file system, system parameters, and network connections to other than the originating host) may be used. (d) Category 2 mobile code that does not execute in a constrained environment may be used when obtained from a trusted source over an assured channel (e.g., SIPRNet, SSL connection, S/MIME, code is signed with an approved code signing certificate). (e) Category 3 (mobile code having limited functionality, with no capability for unmediated access to the services and resources of a computing platform) mobile code may be used.

SC-18(3).defined_value: All unacceptable mobile code such as: (a) Emerging mobile code technologies that have not undergone a risk assessment and been assigned to a Risk Category by the CIO. (b) unsigned Category 1 mobile code and Category 1 mobile code technologies that cannot block or disable unsigned mobile code (e.g., Windows Scripting Host). (d) Category 2 mobile code not obtained from a trusted source over an assured channel (e.g., SIPRNet, SSL connection, S/MIME, code is signed with an approved code signing certificate).

SC-18(4).defined_value: Software applications and such as but not limited to email, scriptable document/file editing applications that support documents with embedded code (e.g., MS Office applications/documents), etc. Prompting the user for permission.

SC-24.control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined known-state] [Assignment: organization-defined types of failures] [Assignment: organization-defined system state information]
SC-24.defined_value: Known secure state. All types of failures. Information necessary to determine cause of failure and to return to operations with least disruption to mission/business processes.

SC-28.control_text: [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] Assignment: organization-defined information at rest]
SC-28.defined_value: Confidentiality and integrity. All information not cleared for public release.

SC-28(1).control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined information] [Assignment: organization-defined information system components]
SC-28(1).defined_value: All information not cleared for public release. System components outside of organization facilities.

SC-43.defined_value: All information system components (through the use of an acceptable use agreement).

SI-1.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] b.1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] b.2. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
SI-1.defined_value: a. All personnel. b.1. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. b.2. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

SI-2.defined_value: c. 30 days if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

SI-2(6).defined_value: All upgraded/replaced software and firmware components that are no longer required for operation when possible.

SI-3.control_text: c.1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] [Selection (one or more); endpoint; network entry/exit points] 2. [Selection (one or more): block malicious code; quarantine malicious code; send alert to administrator; [Assignment: organization-defined action]]
SI-3.defined_value: c.1. At least weekly. Endpoints and network entry/exit points. c2. Block and quarantine malicious code then send an alert to the system administrator. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

SI-3(8).control_text: [Assignment: organization-defined unauthorized operating system commands] [Assignment: organization-defined information system hardware components] [Selection (one or more): issues a warning; audits the command execution; prevents the execution of the command]
SI-3(8).defined_value: Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Audits the command execution and prevents the execution of the command.

SI-5.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined external organizations] c. [Selection (one or more): [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] [Assignment: organization-defined elements within the organization] [Assignment: organization-defined external organizations]]
SI-5.defined_value: a. Minimally the US-CERT. c. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

SI-6.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined security functions] b. [Selection (one or more): [Assignment: organization-defined system transitional states]; upon command by user with appropriate privilege [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]]; c. [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] d. [Selection (one or more): shuts the information system down; restarts the information system [Assignment: organization-defined alternative action(s)]
SI-6.defined_value: a. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. b. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. c. Minimally notifies system/security administrator. d. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

SI-6(3).defined_value: Responsible security personnel (e.g., AO, SISO, ISSO, ISSM, etc.).

SI-7(9).defined_value: All devices capable of verification of the boot process.

SI-7(15).defined_value: All software and firmware from vendors/sources that provide cryptographic mechanisms to enable the validation of code authenticity and integrity.

SI-10.defined_value: All inputs to web/application servers, database servers, and any system or application input that might receive a crafted exploit toward executing some code or buffer overflow.

PM-1.defined_value: b. At least annually if not otherwise defined informal organizational policy.

PM-9.control_text: c. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] NIST SP 800-53 Rev4, Appendix J, Privacy Control Catalog
PM-9.defined_value: c. At least annually if not otherwise defined informal organizational policy.

AR-1.control_text: c. [Assignment: organization-defined allocation of budget and staffing] f. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency, at least biennially]
AR-1.defined_value: c. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS. f. At least biennially if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

AR-5.control_text: b. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency, at least annually] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency, at least annually] c. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency, at least annually]
AR-5.defined_value: b. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. c. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

DI-1.defined_value: At least every 180 days if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

DI-1(2).defined_value: At least every 180 days if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

DM-1.control_text: c. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency, at least annually]
DM-1.defined_value: c. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.

DM-2.defined_value: a. In accordance with National Archives and Records Administration (NARA). c. Not appropriate to define at the CNSS level for all NSS.

SE-1.control_text: a. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] b. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]
SE-1.defined_value: a. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy. b. At least annually if not otherwise defined in formal organizational policy.
